The advance puts the city of Selidovo in a critical situation as Ukrainians are now surrounded on three-sides, with just Selidovo-Lisovko route free. However, after capturing Novgrodovka's western waste-heap yesterday and with this height advantage the final Selidovo-Lisovko route is now also under Russian fire range.

Title: 🇮🇷🇮🇱 - Initial thoughts from Admin: This strike was huge. Thi...
Description: 🇮🇷🇮🇱 - Initial thoughts from Admin:This strike was huge. This attack was also very well calibrated, at the same time appearing indiscriminate and heavy-handed. Iran may have made up for the last 2 months of inaction.Hundreds of missiles struck Israel. Israel's air defenses were completely overwhelmed, and in multiple cases simply did not fire on Iranian missiles.Israel will respond for this. This won't go unanswered. There's a very high likelihood that this leads to a kinetic exchange between Iran and Israel, and this very much could break out into a full-scale regional war.Only time will tell.

Description: Rerum Novarum // Intel, Breaking News, and Alerts: 🇲🇱🇷🇺⚡- Malian Armed Forces with the help of the Wagner group have launched an offensive to capture CSP-DPA stronghold of Tin Zautin, northern Mali. 🇲🇱🇷🇺⚡- Wagner forces with the Malian Armed Forces (FAMa) have launched two separate axes of assaults in a likely attempt to pincer Tin Zautin, northern Mali.FAMa and Wagner forces overnight have reached the outskirts of Tin Essako (Kidal direction). There are unconfirmed reports that the CSP-DPA have completely withdrawn from the city - leaving JNIM alone. In the Tin Zautin direction, confirmed battles are taking place at JNIM stronghold of Boughessa.Rumors of a Wagner and FAMa attack on Telabit (Kidal direction) are not true, there has been no fighting reported in this sector.The current Wagner counter-offensive has already yielded more results in just a single night than the previous offensive in June and July.

Title: 🇺🇸⚡️- More than 45,000 workers at 36 ports in the United States...
Description: 🇺🇸⚡️- More than 45,000 workers at 36 ports in the United States are going on strike to protest wages and automation after the collapse of negotiations between the US Maritime Alliance and the International Longshoremen's Association on worker compensation and the use of automation.Protests have already been reported in Philadelphia, Houston, New York, New Jersey, Wilmington, Baltimore, Norfolk, Charleston, Savannah, Jacksonville, Miami, Tampa, Mobile, and New Orleans. The strike is expected to seriously impact the US economy, and may drastically interrupt the US supply and logistics chain for many weeks.

Title: 🔁 Israel has had surprising success with its airstrikes, assassi...
Description: Forwarded From Nicholas J. FuentesIsrael has had surprising success with its airstrikes, assassinations, and cyberattacks against Hezbollah— but if the War Cabinet is seriously considering a ground operation in south Lebanon that could be a different story.Israel certainly wants the world to think that this is imminent, whether or not they intend to follow through. Maybe it’s leverage, maybe it’s bait.If Israel is planning an invasion it will be a completely different story than the ongoing conflict. Israel can’t rely on airpower and tech -wizardry- alone, they’ll have to overcome the tactical problems that cost them the war in 2006.This leads me to believe the -invasion plans- might be a gambit to bait Iran or Hezbollah into a counterattack so that Israel can draw the United States further in before any major offensive in Lebanon. Then again, many said that Israel wouldn’t go into Gaza last year and then they did.But Hezbollah is much tougher than Hamas.

Title: ↩️🖼 🇸🇩⚡- Sudanese Armed Forces, SAF, have broken into central ...
Description: Rerum Novarum // Intel, Breaking News, and Alerts: 🇸🇩⚡- A major Sudanese counterattack in northern Khartoum. Sudan's Armed Forces, SAF, have crossed the al-Halfaia Bridge into the al-Kadroo district. SAF posted a video claiming control over Rayhan Hospital in the north, at 15.73882, 32.56492. The major… 🇸🇩⚡- Sudanese Armed Forces, SAF, have broken into central Khartoum from two directions. In the north, SAF have crossed the Shambat Bridge into the al-Sababi district. SAF posted footage which was geolocated to Azhari Road, at 15.64179, 32.51896. The purpose of this offensive is likely to breach the encirclement of SAF in the al-Waburat district. In the south SAF crossed the Blue Nile Bridge. Geolocated footage shows SAF at 15.60303, 32.51335, on al-Gamhuriya Avenue. The advance therefore confirms SAF control over the National Museum and more importantly over the Tuti Bridge opposite the museum. Rapid Support Forces, RSF, on the Tuti Island have been completely cut off as the only access to the island is via the bridge. To the east of the museum fighting is still ongoing at al-Neelain University.

Title: ↩️🖼 🇸🇩⚡- A major Sudanese counterattack in northern Khartoum. ...
Description: Rerum Novarum // Intel, Breaking News, and Alerts: 🇸🇩⚡- Claims of Sudanese Armed Forces taking complete control over Khartoum are false. Rapid Support Forces are still in control of majority of the Alkadroo district. The footage above is geolocated to the Tuti Island, confirming their presence in the center… 🇸🇩⚡- A major Sudanese counterattack in northern Khartoum. Sudan's Armed Forces, SAF, have crossed the al-Halfaia Bridge into the al-Kadroo district. SAF posted a video claiming control over Rayhan Hospital in the north, at 15.73882, 32.56492. The major advance here has cut all access to the Rapid Support Forces, RSF, bridgehead in al-Hatana, northern Omdurman. In the east, SAF advanced 4,000 meters north - both sides reported fierce fighting at Bahri University. The advance here coupled with the advances in the al-Kadroo district, it seems SAF is attempting a pincer attack on the RSF stronghold of Um el-Gora.

Title: ↩️🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦⚡- Major Russian advance in the Pokrovsk direction. ...
Description: Rerum Novarum // Intel, Breaking News, and Alerts: 🇷🇺🇺🇦⚡- Russian forces have entered Nikolaivka, Pokrovsk direction. In the past three days Russian forces have captured Krasniy Yar, Krutyi Yar and have now already entered the eastern outskirts of Nikolaivka. Russia has increased its pace in the Pokrovsk… 🇷🇺🇺🇦⚡- Major Russian advance in the Pokrovsk direction.Russian forces have captured the western half of Nikolaivka as well as Nikolaivka's southern trench line. The capture of this trench will put pressure on Ukrainian positions just south in Novgrodovka's waste-heap.More importantly, Russian forces have crossed the Zhuravka river capturing a significant portion of the Zhuravka line of defenses. Russian troops advanced another 700 meters north, capturing a large Ukrainian fortification known as the 'cat and tail'. The loss of 'cat and tail' has put Russian troops in a strong position to launch an attack on Mirnograd, which is now just 1,650 meters away.UAV footage shows Russian forces taking up positions in the 'cat and tail' at 48.25931, 37.32782, which confirms the advance.

Just east of the 'Flower', Russian troops captured Second Zhelannoe.In the center Russian forces have entered Gornyak from another direction, this time from the north.In the east, Ukraine lost multiple fortifications which has left Tsukurinoe completely exposed. As a result, Russian forces have already entered the first few houses and therefore the battle for the strategic settlement has begun.

Title: ↩️ 🇱🇧🇮🇱 - Admin does believe that Hezbollah will - eventually...
Description: Rerum Novarum // Intel, Breaking News, and Alerts: 🇱🇧🇮🇱 - Some commentary on the increasing tensions between Hezbollah and Israel: It's very obvious that Israel is vigorously working to coax Hezbollah into a massive retaliation in order to acquire a justification to launch a full-scale war against Lebanon.… 🇱🇧🇮🇱 - Admin does believe that Hezbollah will - eventually - retaliate. Iran probably will as well. But, at this point, it will require near pin-point precise calculations and decision making on behalf of Hezbollah and Iran in order to avoid an all-out war.On a purely tactical and strategic basis, Hezbollah has an immense edge against Israel, especially if Israel decided to invade Lebanon. It would be a bloody and brutal war, for both sides, but Hezbollah would likely come out on top in a painful but nonetheless pyrrhic victory. This is only if Hezbollah decides to take decisive and bold action, which they have yet to do.

Title: 🇱🇧🇮🇱 - Some commentary on the increasing tensions between Hez...
Description: 🇱🇧🇮🇱 - Some commentary on the increasing tensions between Hezbollah and Israel:It's very obvious that Israel is vigorously working to coax Hezbollah into a massive retaliation in order to acquire a justification to launch a full-scale war against Lebanon. Of course, this is not in Hezbollah's interest.Hezbollah has stated - since October 8th - that its entire objective is to thwart the ambitions of Israel and to support Hamas in Gaza. If Hezbollah were to launch a massive retaliation, they would be serving Israel exactly what they want on a silver platter, and it would allow Israel to invade Lebanon and turn Lebanon into the next Gaza.At the same time, however, Hezbollah has proven itself for the last 40 years to be the single greatest threat to Israel, besides Iran, as Iran does not share any land border or proximity to Israel. The only way that Hezbollah has maintained this image is by displaying its power and deterrence through occasional spikes in attacks, which Hezbollah has not fully committed to showing off since Israel has -moved the front- to the north.Hezbollah did not have to enter the conflict between Hamas and Israel on October 8th. However, they did, when they really did not have to. It was a very bold but risky move to make, and this move required immense calculus on behalf of Hezbollah's senior leadership in anticipating the worst case scenario, which has arrived. In retrospect, the ruling Likud regime in Israel more than likely wanted and expected Hezbollah to enter the conflict in some way, as this would justify wiping out all of Israel's closest threats, and ultimately finishing off the entire cycle by coaxing the United States into war with Iran, the one country Israel has no chance of defeating on its own.To summarize, Hezbollah is stuck. If they retaliate too strongly for the recent actions of Israel, they risk the entirety of Lebanon being decimated in the same way that Gaza was. If they don't retaliate at all, which is ostensibly what they have been doing for the last few weeks, then they risk being disregarded as a legitimate threat to Israel, they lose all of their deterrence against Israel, and are ultimately destroyed. In short- they're damned if they do, damned if they don't.Hezbollah hasn't miscalculated their actions, it would seem, but they are stuck in an impossible balance of maintaining their security deterrence and strength while also preventing all-out war in Lebanon. Hezbollah is part of the Lebanese political establishment, and so they have accountability to the Lebanese public and political system. It will be very difficult for Hezbollah to maintain any kind of prominence in Lebanon if they are disarmed - whether forcibly by Israel or forcibly by the public - and they will be destroyed in the end.This explains why Hezbollah has done next to nothing in response to the grotesque pager terrorist attacks, followed by the unprecedented airstrikes and decapitation strikes against Hezbollah military leadership. At once, they must retaliate to show their strength, but they also must prevent all-out war in some way shape or form.The only two factors that could break this position that Hezbollah finds itself in are the United States and Iran. If the United States makes it clear they will not support any Israeli incursions into Lebanon, Hezbollah has a lot more wiggle room. However, this is unlikely. If Iran steps in and declares guarantees for Hezbollah and promises to intervene if Israel invades, Israel itself may have to recalculate and that would, in due time, give Hezbollah the room they need to strike back.As we previously wrote, the inaction by the Axis of Resistance has resulted in this situation. Israel definitely fears Hezbollah and Iran, they have made that very clear. However, they also feel free to push around the Axis of Resistance with no consequences, as they have not been attacked properly for their incredibly destabilizing actions.

Title: 🔁 Israel-critical analysts say that Israel will surely suffer a ...
Description: Forwarded From Nicholas J. FuentesIsrael-critical analysts say that Israel will surely suffer a catastrophic defeat in a war with Iran and its Axis of Resistance, but they seem to be ignoring the critical factor which is the potential involvement of the United States.The US has been getting drawn further into the conflict as its personnel have come under fire in Iraq, Syria, and Jordan, it has been forced to engage the Houthis to defend shipping in the Red Sea, Congress armed Israel with $26 billion in aid, and the US navy has mobilized to deter Iran's counter-attacks in April and August.So why is nobody talking about the obvious conclusion? Which is that the supposedly delusional, irrational hopes of Netanyahu to successfully confront Iran and Hezbollah in all likelihood rest on a blank check from the United States guaranteed by a Trump White House.Just as in 2016, Netanyahu is clearly putting his finger on the scale in this election in the hopes that the Zionist-controlled GOP will retake the White House and bail him out. How will they achieve that? False flags.

But it cannot be denied that the deterrence that not just Hezbollah but the AoR once held, the threat they once possessed, the check they held over Israel; that was unraveled today. While the pager attacks in Lebanon today were not massive, and certainly not enough to -cripple- Hezbollah, it's an embarrassment, a massive security failure, and one that the AoR set themselves up for.On a final note, our condolences and prayers are with all of the people of Lebanon as they are preparing to get thrown into the gauntlet of the Jewish war machine. Title: ↩️ 🇱🇧🇮🇱 - Israel has been stacking troops and equipment on th...
Description: Rerum Novarum // Intel, Breaking News, and Alerts: 🇱🇧🇮🇱 - Hezbollah suffered a devastating blow today, thanks to the entirety of the Axis of Resistance ignoring the reality of Israel's ambitions. Today should not have surprised them, and they likely won't even retaliate for today in an appropriate manner. 🇱🇧🇮🇱 - Israel has been stacking troops and equipment on the northern border for the last 10 months. Hezbollah has done next to nothing to scale this back, deal with it preemptively, or establish reliable deterrence with Israel at all. In short- Hezbollah has ignored the realities of Israel's ambitions, which is to destroy all of their neighboring threats, in one war.Hezbollah has had ample time to prepare defenses for something like today. They should have, and likely did know that Israel was planning on moving the frontline to the north. They clearly ignored all possible threats and chose to pretend they were king of the hill.Today, Israel carried out a grotesque and inhumane violation of not just Lebanon's sovereignty, but the dignity of humankind. Blowing up pagers and risking tens of thousands of civilians is something Israel is more than familiar with doing, but Hezbollah dug its head in the sand and pretended like everything was okay.Today's attacks in Lebanon have crippled Hezbollah. Hundreds, if not thousands of fighters are missing fingers, limbs, and eyesight. Those injured today will likely never go back to combat. Hospitals are now packed full of injured innocents, and Hezbollah will never attack Israel when their communications are crippled and their hospitals are filled with innocents.Hezbollah brought this on themselves. Resisting Israel with -strong words of condemnation- and miniscule, pussyfooted attacks is not enough to keep Israel in check. In fact, it energized Israel and made them push the envelope even further.Perhaps the Axis of Resistance wakes up to the reality of their ineptitude, inaction, and weakness- but they likely won't. Eternal third world mindset.

Title: 🇱🇧🇮🇱⚡️- Hezbollah has issued a statement on the attacks in Le...
Description: 🇱🇧🇮🇱⚡️- Hezbollah has issued a statement on the attacks in Lebanon today.-At approximately 3:30 pm on Tuesday 09-17-2024, a number of message receiving devices known as -pagers- exploded, which were owned by a number of workers in various Hezbollah units and institutions. These explosions, the causes of which are still unknown, led to the martyrdom of a girl and two brothers, and the injury of a large number of people with various injuries.Hezbollah's competent agencies are currently conducting a wide-ranging security and scientific investigation to determine the causes that led to these simultaneous explosions. Likewise, medical and health agencies are treating the wounded and injured in a number of hospitals in various Lebanese regions.We ask God Almighty to have mercy on our righteous martyrs on the road to Jerusalem, and we pray for the wounded and injured to recover quickly, and we call on our honorable people to be aware of the rumors and false and misleading information that some parties are spreading in a way that serves the psychological war in the interest of the Zionist enemy, especially since this is accompanied by the Zionist enemy’s speeches of intimidation and threats and what it calls changing the situation in the north.We affirm that the resistance, at all its levels and various units, is at the highest level of readiness to defend Lebanon and its steadfast people.-

Footage from Russian loitering munition strikes on Ukrainian positions occurred just south of Obukhovka, at 51.27094, 34.54866. Recruiting mercenaries and foreign fighters for Ukraine, shilling openly for… 🇺🇸🇺🇦 - Trump has made it a campaign platform to end the war in Ukraine, before he's even inaugurated on January 20th, 2025. If this is to happen, major concessions to Russia on behalf of Ukraine and its sponsors will have to be made. This may have made Trump a target in the eyes of any party that seeks to keep the war going and attempt to topple Putin from power in Russia.

Title: 🇺🇸🇺🇦 - Some comments from admin on the attempted assassinatio...
Description: 🇺🇸🇺🇦 - Some comments from admin on the attempted assassination of Trump:If there was ever the perfect representative of a federal asset, Ryan Wesley Routh embodies it to the tea.Recruiting mercenaries and foreign fighters for Ukraine, shilling openly for NATO, posting his phone number on social media for people to -contact him- to fight in Ukraine, attempting to recruit NATO-trained Afghan fighters to deploy to Ukraine, and his various visits to Ukraine and DC on behalf of -recruiting- for Ukraine- all of this is indicative of someone who either works for the State Department or some other covert federal project to support Ukraine through means other than direct military aid.The only real question is this- why did he target Trump? There seems to be some evidence that this was personal and premeditated, given his somewhat obvious social media objections to Trump dating back to 2020. However, was the targeting of Trump something he was ordered to do by his handlers - who apparently are either State Department or some kind of military complex - or was this his own little venture?Given this attempted assassin actually survived and can be cross-examined, unlike the last shooter, we may find some answers, but given the nature of this man's background and the heavy involvement of the FBI, it's not likely we'll be given a lot of truth, in fact this entire case may end up being memory-holed as an -incident- rather than an attempt on Trump's life.

In the center, Russian forces withdrew from Malaya-Loknya fearing an encirclement, ending a month long fierce battle for the town. Ukrainian forces have moved into Malaya… 🇷🇺🇺🇦⚡- Ukrainian forces advanced significantly over the weekend in the Kursk region, Russia.In the north, Ukrainian forces have captured the entirety of Korenevo forest (16.3 sqkm of area).In the center, after Russian forces withdrew from Malaya Loknya to avoid encirclement, which was vital for the Russians defense in the central axis, the towns of Staraya-Sorochina, Novaya-Sorochina, Orlovka, Maryevka, Pogrebki, Rus-Porechnoe and Naydenov have fallen to the Ukrainians. Both sides report fierce battles taking place for Nachayev.Also along the central axis, Russian forces recaptured Kalinov.There were no changes in the south.The total area Ukraine controls in the Kursk region is 992.5 sqkm – far shorter than Syrskyi's claim of 5,000 sqkm and Zelenskyi's 1,300 sqkm.
